basic_data.Recipient Name: THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA
basic_data.Description: UC AGRICULTURE AND NATURAL RESOURCES (UC ANR) IS THE LAND-GRANT ARM FOR THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA (UC). UC'S AGRICULTURAL EXPERIMENT STATION (AES) IS INTEGRATED WITH UC COOPERATIVE EXTENSION (CE) ACROSS THE STATE. UC ANR HAS AES AND/OR CE ACADEMICS LOCATED ON NINE OF THE TEN UC CAMPUSES, PROGRAMS IN EVERY COUNTY IN CALIFORNIA, UC SYSTEMWIDE INSTITUTES, STATEWIDEPROGRAMS, AND NINE RESEARCH AND EXTENSION CENTERS (RECS) ACROSS THE STATE. INTEGRATING TWO NEW CAMPUSES TO UC'S AES, UC SANTA CRUZ AND UC MERCED, IS A RECENT AND ONGOING EXCITING ENDEAVOR, EXPANDING UC'S RESEARCH PORTFOLIO ON AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD-RELATED ISSUES. IN FFY 2024-25, NINE NEWLY APPOINTED AES FACULTY ON THOSE CAMPUSES WILL BEGIN WORK ON RESEARCH PROJECTS FOCUSED ON CAPACITY-FUNDED PROGRAMS, AND MORE AES FACULTY AND PROJECTS ARE PLANNED FOR MOVING FORWARD.UC ANR ALSO IS GROWING THE CE ACADEMIC FOOTPRINT THROUGH THE RELEASE OF OVER 30 NEW POSITIONS, AS RESULT OF THE 2024 CALL FOR CE POSITIONS. THE UC ANR NETWORK ENGAGES ACADEMICS ACROSS THE ENTIRE UC SYSTEM TO ENCOURAGE INTEGRATED AES AND CE TEAMS TO WORK ON COMPLEX ISSUES THAT REQUIRE MULTIDISCIPLINARY APPROACHES TO FIND SOLUTIONS. UC ANR ACADEMICS WORK WITH COLLEAGUES IN OTHER STATES. THE UC ANR CONNECTIONS ALSO INCLUDE FACULTY FROM THE STATE UNIVERSITY SYSTEM, COMMUNITY COLLEGES, PRIVATE COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, AND PARTNERS REPRESENTING FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES, ORGANIZATIONS REPRESENTING AGRICULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCE PRODUCTION, NON-GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS (NGO'S), AND OTHER INTEREST AREAS INCLUDING THE ENVIRONMENT, YOUTH, AND COMMUNITY NUTRITION AND HEALTH. A NEWLY DEVELOPED 2040 STRATEGIC VISION DOCUMENT SERVES AS A BLUEPRINT TO GUIDE UC ANR WORK, STRUCTURE, AND RESOURCE ALLOCATION OVER THE NEXT 15 YEARS. THE VISIONING EFFORT WAS INFORMED BY INPUT FROM HUNDREDS OF UC ANR PERSONNEL, EXTERNAL PARTNERS, AND CLIENTELE ACROSS THE STATE. LISTED BELOW ARE THE REFRESHED UC ANR MISSION AND VISIONAND THE UPDATED LIST OF SEVEN CHALLENGES FACING CALIFORNIA THAT UC ANR'S RESEARCH AND ENGAGEMENTIS WELL POSITIONED TO ADDRESS. OUR MISSION UC ANR CULTIVATES THRIVING COMMUNITIES, SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE, RESILIENT ECOSYSTEMS, AND ECONOMIC PROSPERITY IN CALIFORNIA THROUGH DEVELOPMENT AND SHARING OF EQUITABLE AND COLLABORATIVE SCIENCE-BASED SOLUTIONS THAT HAVE NATIONAL AND GLOBAL IMPACT. OUR VISION UC ANR WILL BE VALUED IN EVERY CALIFORNIA COMMUNITY FOR MEANINGFUL ENGAGEMENT AND MAKING A POSITIVE IMPACT IN PEOPLE'S LIVES. THE SEVEN CHALLENGE AREAS ARE COMPLEX AND INTERRELATED, DEMANDING INTERDISCIPLINARY APPROACHES TO DRIVE EQUITABLE, APPROPRIATE, AND PRACTICAL SOLUTIONS. THE FIRST THREE CHALLENGES SPECIFICALLY RELATE TO UC ANR'S RESEARCH AND PROGRAMMING CORE: AGRICULTURE AND FOOD SYSTEMS; NATURAL ECOSYSTEMS AND WORKING LANDSCAPES; AND THRIVING PEOPLE AND COMMUNITIES. THE OTHER FOUR CHALLENGES ARE OVERARCHING AND IMPACT ALL AREAS OF UC ANR RESEARCH AND PROGRAMMATIC ACTIVITY: CLIMATE CHANGE; INNOVATION; REGULATIONS, POLICY, AND COMPLIANCE; AND SYSTEMIC INEQUITIES
basic_data.Awarding Sub Agency: National Institute of Food and Agriculture
